result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse D Pietrzak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse D Pietrzak in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:40 AM Court calls case.
Atty Constable states appearances.

Address of Defendant is verified.

An agreement has been reached.
State moves to dismiss and read in Count 2.
Defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 3.

Atty Constable states plea agreement.
Atty Drengler concurs.
Defendant concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: NO CONTEST
Count 3: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Misdemeanor Battery - Domestic
Count 2: Dismissed and Read In
Count 3: Disorderly Conduct

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court believes the plea agreement is fair and appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
30 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed
2 Days Jail Credit should probation be revoked
Probation for a period of 24 Months
Conditions:
Pay costs
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Obtain an AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Agent can acceopt the AODA assessment already completed
Maintain absolute sobriety
Not to possess or consume controlled substance without a valid prescription and take only as prescribed
Take medications only as prescribed
Sign releases of information
No abusive contact with Heather Kinder
Complete a parenting class
Participate in other counseling as recommended by the agent

Count 3:
90 Day Jail Sentence, Imposed and Stayed, consecutive to Count 1
Probation for a period of 24 Months, concurrent to Count 1
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 1
Pay costs
Pay DNA surcharge
Plea hearing on March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Portage County Community Justice Program Court Referral Form

Maintain Absolute Sobriety. Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.  Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  On All Scheduled Court Dates.   Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  *H.K. *Unless a written request  from the victim and a Family Safety Plan is filed with the District Attorney and the Clerk of Courts.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.   

2/2/15 - Bond is modified to no abusive contact with Robert Pettigrew.

Defendant Jessie D Pietrzak in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:00 am.  Court calls the case. 

Atty Drengler makes statements.  Moves to amend the bond to no abusive contact. 
Court reviews the file.  Does not see a notice of motion and motion but does see a letter from Mr. Pettigrew. 
Atty Constable does not object to the no contact being lifted.  
Court reviews the file further.  
Atty Drengler makes additional statements to the Court.  

BY THE COURT:  Based on the request and statements of the parties, no abusive contact with Robert Pettigrew.

Insufficient Address Unable to Forward
2/2/15 PTC
Pre-trial conference on February 2, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Jessie D Pietrzak in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Defendant believes he will qualify. 

Court enteres NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf.

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued. 

Court advises defendant to see the public defender today.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 09:45 am.
